div1.p: Hench requests Report No. 841, 71st Congress from the Government Printing Office.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Alton P. Tisdel, March 21, 1941
div1.opener:
MAYO CLINIC
ROCHESTER, MINNESOTA
March 21, 1941
DR. PHILIP S. HENCH
DR. CHARLES H. SLOCUMB
RECEIVED
SUPERINTENDENT OF DOCUMENTS
MAR
24
1941
Mr. Alton P. Tisdel
Superintendent Government
Printing Office
Washington, D. C.
AIR MAIL
My dear Mr. Tisdel:
div1.p:
I am leaving for Florida and Havana tonight
in connection with the yellow fever reservations about which I
have written you previously. Do you have available the
following item: House of Representatives. Report No. 841.
71st Congress, 2nd Session. Entitled HONOR THE MEMORY OF
THE HEROES OF THE FIGHT AGAINST YELLOW FEVER. This report
is 25 pages long and I am most anxious to get three copies and
would appreciate greatly if you would send them to me not
at the Clinic but at one of the following addresses:
Mar. 21 to 28 or 29 - Villa Atlantique Hotel, Palm Beach,
Fla.
Mar. 28 or 29 to April 4 or 5 - Hotel Nacional, Havana,
Cuba
Please send it air mail, special delivery.

If these are not available will you send my
secretary, Miss Fern Peterson, Mayo Clinic, a notice to that
affect as soon as possible so that she may have a photostatic copy
made from the book we have borrowed from an out-of-town
library.
div1.closer: Sincerely yours, P. S. Hench, M. D. PSH:FP
